questions.text: Which layer in the OSI model is responsible for end-to-end flow control?
questions.explanation: The Transport layer provides end-to-end flow control and reliability.

questions.text: Which protocol uses port 53 by default?
questions.explanation: DNS uses port 53 for queries and responses.

questions.text: Which control mitigates SQL injection attacks?
questions.explanation: Validating and parameterizing inputs helps prevent SQL injection.

questions.text: What does MFA primarily improve?
questions.explanation: Multi-factor authentication improves confidentiality by strengthening access control.

questions.text: Which index type is best for range queries?
questions.explanation: B-tree indexes are optimized for range scans.

questions.text: Which normalization form removes transitive dependency?
questions.explanation: 3NF removes transitive dependencies.

questions.text: What is the default subnet mask for a /24 network?
questions.explanation: A /24 network corresponds to 255.255.255.0.

questions.text: Which device operates at Layer 3?
questions.explanation: Routers operate at Layer 3 (Network layer).

questions.text: Which encryption method uses a public/private key pair?
questions.explanation: Asymmetric encryption relies on public/private key pairs.

questions.text: Which is an example of a physical security control?
questions.explanation: Badge readers are physical access controls.

questions.text: What does ACID stand for?
questions.explanation: ACID stands for Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability.

questions.text: Which chart is best for showing task dependencies over time?
questions.explanation: Gantt charts visualize tasks and dependencies over time.

questions.text: Which document defines project scope and objectives?
questions.explanation: The project charter defines scope and objectives.

questions.text: Which metric tracks how much work is completed compared to the plan?
questions.explanation: A burndown chart shows completed work versus plan over time.

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of a risk assessment?
questions.explanation: Risk assessments identify and prioritize risks for mitigation.

questions.text: Which protocol is used for secure web traffic?
questions.explanation: HTTPS secures web traffic using TLS.

questions.text: Which command adds a new row to a SQL table?
questions.explanation: INSERT adds a new row to a table.

questions.text: What does NAT stand for?
questions.explanation: NAT stands for Network Address Translation.

questions.text: Which security principle ensures users have only needed access?
questions.explanation: Least privilege limits access to only what is required.

questions.text: Which backup type stores only changes since the last full backup?
questions.explanation: Differential backups store changes since the last full backup.

questions.text: Which technique ranks risks by impact and likelihood?
questions.explanation: A risk matrix ranks risks by impact and likelihood.
